Class GameBoard

java.lang.Object
GameBoard
public class GameBoard
extends java.lang.Object
A class used to create, fill and print the game board. The game board is created before the game starts, filled with the latest X's and O's during the game and printed after each pair of moves. The game board is printed also when the last to move is the player.

    GameBoard()

    A method used to fill the game board with new X's and O's.
    static void printGameBoard​(int gameAreaSize, java.lang.String[][] gameBoard)

  • Method Details

    • createGameBoard

      public static java.lang.String[][] createGameBoard​(int gameAreaSize, java.lang.String[][] gameBoard)
      A method used to create the game board before the game starts. Also demonstrates the game board to the player.
      Parameters:
      gameAreaSize - Is used in for-loops creating and demonstrating the game board.
      gameBoard - Is used in for-loops creating and demonstrating the game board.
      Returns:
      Returns the array gameBoard, which contains the newly created game board.

    • fillGameBoard

      public static java.lang.String[][] fillGameBoard​(java.lang.String[][] gameBoard, int[] playerPosition, int[] computerPosition)
      A method used to fill the game board with new X's and O's.
      Parameters:
      gameBoard - Is used in filling the game board with new X's and O's.
      playerPosition - Contains the latest position for X.
      computerPosition - Contains the latest position for O.
      Returns:
      Returns the array gameBoard, which contains the newly updated game board.

    • printGameBoard

      public static void printGameBoard​(int gameAreaSize, java.lang.String[][] gameBoard)
      A method used to print the current game board.
      Parameters:
      gameAreaSize - Is used in printing the game board.
      gameBoard - Is used in printing the game board.
